head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 13/5/73 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that I have this day received from Signor Zanardini of Venice, one of my Italian scientific Correspondents, four of his costly...

div.p: J73/10422, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to inform you, that I have this day received from Signor Zanardini of Venice, one of my Italian scientific Correspondents, four of his costly illustrated volumes on Mediterranean Seaplants, which valuable donation I have deposited in the Library of my Department.
The library at MEL has three of Zanardnini's publications on Mediterranean algae, Zanardini (1842), Zanardini (1847), and the first two vols of Zanardini (1860-74). However the copies of Zanardini (1842) and Zanardini (1847) are photocopies, so cannot be items given to M. The library also holds Zanardini (1858) and Zanardini (1872) which both, although they do not match the geographic description, include plates. The first volume of Zanardini (1860-74) and the copy of Zanardini (1872) have inscriptions from Zanardini to M. I have now the honor to recommend, that a return gift may be rendered to this generous and celebrated savant by sending him on behalf of the Victorian Government my own here published works in return, and accordingly submit a requisition for your consideration.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be your obedient Servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The hon. the Minister of Lands.
Is there a letter in outwards 15 May 1873?
